results.title: The Stunt man
results.creator_credit: Richard Rush and Melvin Simon Productions
results.brief_description: A mysterious fugitive escapes from the law and ends up becoming a stunt man under a mesmerizing, possibly insane movie director (Peter O’Toole). Explores the ever changing nature of reality and illusion. Cast also includes Steve Railsback, Barbara Hershey.

results.title: Loot
results.creator_credit: Silvio Narizzano, Arthur Lewis and Performing Arts
results.brief_description: After a bank heist, the Inspector is called upon to investigate the suspects: a gold-digging nurse, a widower, and a dead body. When the criminals are discovered, a chase ensues, and an arrest is made. Cast includes Richard Attenborough, Lee Remick, Hywel Bennett, Milo O’Shea, Dick Emery, Joe Lynch, Aubrey Woods. Based on the play by Joe Orton.

results.title: With time to kill
results.creator_credit: James Clayden, AFTRS, Australian Film Commission and Chair Films
results.brief_description: Filmed on location in Melbourne this is a tale of justice and revenge when two cops decide that the court system has failed and it is now up to them to take the law into their own hands. Cast includes Ian Scott, Elizabeth Huntley, Jan Friedl, James Clayden, John Howard, Stephen Cummins, Barry Dickins, Joe Dolce, Nigel Buesst, Neil Gladwin. Music by Chris Knowles, Stephen Cummins, Ollie Olsen. Director of photography, Laurie McInnes.

results.title: The Secret policeman's other ball
results.creator_credit: Julien Temple, Peter Walker, Martin Lewis and Amnesty International
results.brief_description: Featuring some of Britain’s most loved and highly respected entertainers of comedy and rock music, this filmed live performance at the Theatre Royal, Drury Lane, London is an absolute ball - witty, outrageous, political, funny, but most of all, entertaining. It combines the winning elements of comedy sketches including some memorable Monty Python skits, stand-up comedy, and music performances by such stars as Rowan Atkinson, John Cleese, Tim Brooke-Taylor, Graham Chapman, Alexei Sayle, Bob Geldof, Jeff Beck, Eric Clapton, Donovan, Sting, Phil Collins and even Australia’s own inimitable Barry Humphries. Also features a special guest appearance by Michael Palin. Presented by Amnesty International with all royalties from the video going to Amnesty International. Stage show directed by Ronald Eyre.

results.title: When you're in love
results.brief_description: A light romantic musical comedy featuring Cary Grant in the role of Jimmy Hudson, an artist who finds himself involved in a bizarre plot with an Australian opera star by the name of Louise Fuller (played by American born Grace Moore). Louise Fuller is desperate to perform in America but cannot obtain a visa, and the only other way she can enter America is if she is married. On meeting the handsome artist, Louise cons him into a marriage of convenience offering him the sum of $2,000 for his part in the scheme. And so begins a most unlikely liaison, a mis-matched couple who continually battle it out with each other until finally love steps in. The highlight among the many songs featured in the film is “Minnie the Moocher”, a sultry, sexy song wonderfully performed by Grace Moore, an opera singer in real life. Story based on an idea by Ethel Hill and Cedric Worth with original music by Jerome Kern. Cast also includes Aline MacMachon, Henry Stephenson, Thomas Mitchell, Catharine Doucet.

results.title: The Man in grey
results.creator_credit: Leslie Arliss, Edward Black and Gainsborough Pictures
results.brief_description: First of the very popular British costume melodramas produced by Gainsborough and often thought of as the best in the collection, “The Man in grey” is a tale of intrigue that twists and turns its way to a dramatic conclusion. The story begins at an antique auction in London during WWII and then proceeds to flashback to 19th century regal England to the aristocratic world of Clarissa Richmond (Phyllis Calvert) and her loveless marriage to the rather indifferent Lord Rohan (James Mason) - the “man in grey”, whose sole intent is in fathering an heir. Clarissa soon finds herself distracted by the attentions of the handsome Rokeby (Stewart Granger) introduced to her by her old schoolfriend, Hester (Margaret Lockwood) who in turn falls for Lord Rohan. Deceit, love and betrayal weave their way into this web of treachery where circumstances and fate can only lead to a tragic conclusion. Magnificent performances by all four stars. Based on the novel by Lady Eleanor Smith, adapted by Doreen Montgomery with screenplay by Margaret Kennedy and Leslie Arliss.

results.title: The Last unicorn [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Jules Bass, Arthur Rankin Jnr, Bass in association with ITC Films and Rankin-Bass Productions
results.brief_description: This classic fairy tale for audiences of all ages tells the story of a beautiful unicorn who leaves her home in the lilac woods in the hope of finding another unicorn somewhere in the world. Escorted by Schmendrick, an inept wizard, she tries to find King Haggard’s castle where the evil red bull lives. The distinguished cast of voices includes Mia Farrow, Alan Arkin, Jeff Bridges, Angela Lansbury, Tammy Grimes, Christopher Lee and Keenan Wynn. Based on the novel by Peter S. Beagle.

results.title: If ever I see you again
results.brief_description: A film you will either love or hate - but certainly one for the romantics out there. This is pure 70s in every way, especially the music and the fashion. “If ever I see you again” is a story of first love lost and broken in the winter of 1966 and rekindled once more in the winter of 1978. Bob Morrison (Joe Brooks), a jingle writer in New York and widowed with two children takes up an opportunity to create music for a movie in California. On reaching California, Bob who has never forgotten his first teenage love, Jennifer Corly (Shelley Hack), finds that she is now living in California. Unable to resist seeking her out, Bob makes contact and the two, after a lot of soul-searching and comings and goings, eventually get it together. With love songs playing in the background, romantic scenes in the snow and warm Christmassy moments, what more can you ask for! This is Joe Brooks’ film - he produced, directed, starred, composed, arranged and conducted the music and wrote, along with Martin Davidson, the screenplay. Cast also includes Jimmy Breslin, Jerry Keller, Kenny Karen, George Plimpton.

results.title: The Rise of Catherine the Great [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Paul Czinner, Ludovico Toeplitz, Alexander Korda, Korda-Toeplitz Productions and London Film Productions
results.brief_description: This biographical drama loosely based on historical facts is set in mid-18th century Russia during the reign of the somewhat domineering and determined Empress Elisabeth (played by the wonderful Dame Flora Robson) who in her waning years sets out to arrange a marriage between her nephew and heir to the throne, Grand Duke Peter (Douglas Fairbanks Jnr) and a young German princess named Catherine (Elizabeth Bergner). It is not long, however, before Catherine discovers that her dearly betrothed is both unfaithful and madly insane and yet for all this, she remains devoted and true to him. But with the death of Empress Elisabeth, and Peter’s ascension to the throne, life becomes more unpredictable and precarious for Catherine as Peter’s mental health and behaviour becomes more unstable. Circumstances take control and eventually Catherine is forced to assume power. This is an interesting piece of filming for its time and the quality acting and lavish sets certainly add to its depth. Cast also includes Gerald Du Maurier, Irene Vanbrugh, Diana Napier. NB: Filmed in black and white, the visual quality is quite dark in some scenes and the soundtrack is scratchy but still worth viewing.

results.title: Saving Grace
results.creator_credit: Nigel Cole, Mark Crowdy, Portman Entertainment Group, Homerun Productions and Fine Line Features
results.brief_description: Grace Trevethan (Brenda Blethyn) is a passionate gardener and housewife whose cloistered world is threatened by the sudden death of her husband. Grace discovers that not only was he unfaithful but he also left her saddled with enormous debt. Having no means of supporting herself, Grace is convinced by a friend to apply her considerable horticulture skills to growing marijuana and make a quick fortune. All goes well until Grace has to deal with the seedy trading of the goods and the attentions of the local constabulary. “Saving Grace”, directed by Nigel Cole, can probably best be described as quirky feel-good English comedy with a touch of dark humour nudging the sides; it also has undertones of female liberation as Grace gains empowerment over her life. Brenda Blethyn is credible as Grace but the comedy flounders often as, despite some enjoyably anarchic moments, the narrative also calls for some dreadfully unlikely ones. Cast also includes: Craig Ferguson, Martin Clunes, Tcheky Karyo, and Jamie Forman.
